stories.text:
I launched MVP - website builder for podcasters a year ago just to validate my idea. Reached $1000MRR, earned over $10k in the last year, reInvested that money and reLaunched a few days ago!

In case I've already validated my idea (hope so) the main target of this post is not to get feedback or to get more customers (of course both are nice to have :D). The main purpose of my post is to say that everybody knows so far, but probably sometimes ignores it. It doesn't make sense to spend months or years implementing "all possible features" and spending time on pixel-shifting. Just get that shit out as soon as possible and try to sell it. You will have time for improvements and polishing later on, and the most important part - you will have some feedback from your early customers, they will give you the directions!

Yes I know, this is nothing new. I've read this many times before, but somehow ignored it, burned more than 6 years building things that nobody needs, and of course none of them are running today.

This website builder was my first try to go with MVP:

1. Launched MVP on December 2020

2. Found early customers in the next months

3. Collected a feedback and implemented the most requested features

4. After noticing that it's growing month by month, invested almost all earned $ into reBranding: premium domain https://onpodium.com (previously it was podsite.io), hired designer for logo, website design, paid for consultations with marketers, implemented many different features and relaunched/rebranded two days ago

5. The TODO list is still huge, but it's not MVP anymore and I can't wait for what will happen in 2022!

I didn't say anything new, but if this post will trigger at least one of you to think again that MVP is enough for the start - then I think it's enough! :)

Good luck with your side projects!
stories.title: MVP is definitely the way to go
